data.title: Such a fun date night!
data.text: This has been one of my favorite date nights I've been on with my boyfriend. We love wine and getting artsy, so we decided to give one of the classes a try around Valentine's day/week. We had Lance for a floating lantern painting and we were blown away not only by the painting and by how well it turned out at the end, but by how entertaining Lance was from beginning to end. He made the painting a show! And paired with the wine, all anxiety of whether or not our paintings would turn out well went out the window. We were able to relax and laugh and have so much fun. We have been back multiple times for Lance's classes and have brought family members along who enjoyed it as well. Bring your mom here, bring your girlfriend here, bring your girls who are friends, but even our dads enjoyed this class so bring them, too!

data.title: Great times with family
data.text: Went with my daughter, mom, and. 2 sisters to paint a flower we had picked out. We brought wine and snacks. Our artist was Irene. She was fun and kept us moving. Our group laughed and joked and had a great time. Who knew it could be so hard to paint a flower petal. LOL. The time went by too fast, we didn't want it to end. We'll be back.

data.title: Awesome birthday night without kids ;)
data.text: Had a really good time at Painting with a Twist!  Bring your own wine and they take care of the rest.  Lance was the instructor & he made it so much fun!  Having never painted before, it was really easy to do and turned out very nice.  I look forward to going back!

data.title: Great Idea for a Private Party
data.text: I had a private party here and everyone had a great time.  BYOB and snacks.  Everything you need to paint is included.  If you book a party, you get to choose the painting from a huge catalog.  Fun!

data.title: Fun get together
data.text: Always a blast painting....no experience necessary, they show you step by step what to do. Nice2 hour project, bring wine,beer and cheese to help the painter!!  LOL

data.title: Great fun!
data.text: I have been to PWAT a couple of times and had a great time each time. The instructors are fun and good at breaking down the instructions so that you can create a great painting. I would definitely recommend this place as a fun outing for friends or couples.

data.title: So much Fun!
data.text: I highly recommend this for everyone! They have a room in the back for private parties. You can get online and choose which time you (and or your group) want to go to paint one of the many different paintings that you choose from. You can bring your own wine. It is priced fairly. Each teacher is lots of  fun and very professional. One of the best times I have ever had. They give you breaks and are very accommodating to people who need it. It is a must go while you are here!

data.title: So much FUN and you leave with your painting
data.text:
I was reluctant to go thinking it would be silly and no fun.  Boy, was I wrong.  They let you take your alcohol in early.  We had cosmos (yum).  The place was packed on a Tuesday night.  Our teacher, Lance, was so fun; he really set the tone. High energy and silly fun.

Everyone completed their painting, and we all very much enjoyed the experience.  I highly recommend for a different, fun evening.

data.title: Great time with mom
data.text: Great time! My three sisters and mom had a fun time painting. We left the studio with wonderful works of art.

data.title: very fun
data.text:
No painting experience at all and my painting turned out amazing :) 
There was a group of us, all ladies, and we all had a fantastic time.

data.title: Fun for everyone!
data.text: This is a great place to come with friends and have a party.  I've been to two parties here.  We brought our own beverages and snacks and took the half hour before our painting session to celebrate and then we all painted.  Everyone went home with a painting worthy of displaying.  It is a fun activity to do.

data.title: Fun Evening With Girlfriends
data.text:
A few girlfriends and I decided to sign up for a painting class at Painting With a Twist and we had such a good time. The process starts by looking over the painting calendar on their website. You see an image of the picture you will be painting so you can pick a design that appeals to you. The website tells you how many seats are left in the class and you reserve online with a credit card. If you are going with others, but everyone is paying separately, there is a section on the sign up page where you tell them the other people in your group so that you sit together. 

The location is a cute building in the Downtown Melbourne area. Street parking is available in front of the building, or there is a lot behind the building. When we checked in we were given frequent visitor cards that can get punched if you return to take other classes. Our names were written on paper plates at our places in the classroom and they already had the easels, canvases, brushes, water, and paints set out at our locations when we arrived. Aprons are hanging on the wall to cover your clothes. Bathrooms were available.

Our class was completely full and they had a separate private party going on in a back room. The class was 80% women, with only a handful of men. However, they have some couples specific painting classes where each couple paints one half of an image on separate canvases that can be hung together (for example, two fish kissing, a wine bottle pouring into a wine glass). 

Only one member of my group had been there previously, so we were mostly all completely new to the process. The instructor stood at the front of the class with his own canvas and took us step by step through the process. Another instructor walked around offering suggestions on brush strokes or to refill paint. There was a lot of laughing and poking fun at one another's painting skills (or lack there of). About half way through we took a break so that some of the background could dry and the instructor played a game seeing who had something in their purse or wallet (a spray can of mace, a dollar bill with a certain serial number, etc) with chances to win a coffee cup or wine glass with the Painting With a Twist logo. 

Our paintings came out better than most of us anticipated and we all agreed that we would be pleased to return to do this again in the future and that it would be a fun place to hold an adult birthday party.

data.title: First Time Visit
data.text: This was my first time at PWT and will definitely go again.  I am not a painter but came out finding my inner artistic side and proud of my work. It's addicting and can't wait to go again.  Although next time I'll bring my sparkling wine...

data.title: Fun and exciting
data.text: Awesome place to have a party. Although i wasn't there for one, there was a few going on while I was there. It was fun and exciting. Was BYOB so you an drink wine and be merry.

data.title: Fun time, but beware the lushes!
data.text:
While visiting a friend in Florida, she made plans for us to come to Painting With A Twist so that we would have something fun and different to do. Neither of us had tried it before, but her sister had and she recommended it. When we went, we really did have a good time. I'm not really a strong artist at all but the instructor gave very clear instructions and also went a very good pace that wasn't boring but didn't make me feel rushed either. There was also a secondary instructor walking the floor to help anyone out who was struggling. Our painting for the evening was a manatee and surprisingly, mine came out actually looking like a manatee. I was pretty proud of it.
The other aspect of the night, the wine, was also very enjoyable. Having a drink of wine while your painting is nice and relaxing and makes it feel like a nice, adult activity instead of like a paint by numbers. However, the issue does come in to play that some people did over indulge slightly and that brought down the zen-like atmosphere. It might have only been an issue since it was the weekend before St. Patrick's day, but if you go, be aware that you stand the chance of being around people who might have a little too much fun. All in all, though, I would love to go back and try this again!

data.title: Fun Painting
data.text: Im not an artist, but made a nice painting. Great place to meet your friends,bring a bottle of wine and learn to paint. The instructors give step by step directions so everybody is sucessful. Space is beautiful too. I'd go again next time I'm in town.
